name: Hotel Pepper Tree

reviews.text: While not completely disappointed with our stay at this hotel, I wouldn't stay here again. The location was 10 minutes driving time to Disneyland, which suited us well. Breakfast was offered at the restaurant next door for a minimal fee. The breakfast was on par with other chain hotels. Wi-fi was available for a $5 fee for your entire stay. We did not take advantage of the pool while we were there. The lobby was nicely decorated and inviting. The staff was mildly pleasant but not overly helpful. We were always able to find parking close to the front door.
reviews.title: Eh........it was just okay.

reviews.text: The rooms were not what I had hoped. The carpet in our 1-bedroom apartment was ripped up. The kitchen was poorly stocked.....at least for a family of 7. I wasn't able to get any more glasses from the hotel. I wasn't impressed with the job that housekeeping did. On one day they didn't show up until around 7pm to clean our room. The rooms just felt a bit dingy overall. That said, I did find the room to be quiet and comfortable.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought the price was fair for the room, but I don't think I'd stay here again. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't anything special. I think the reviews on this site (which I based my stay on) exaggerated the qualities of this hotel. It wasn't a bad stay, but it didn't add anything to our trip either.
reviews.title: Really disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've lived on four continents and stayed in hotels for six weeks at a time all my life, so I am well aquainted with hotels from the best to the worst. My family loved this hotel, it was clean, spacious, quiet, and very cute. The kitchenette was well supplied with all utensils, pots/pans, etc. The stove and fridge saved us a ton of money not having to eat out all the time. Closet space and drawer space was great. Our room overlooked the pool and it was lovely to sit out on the full-length balcony and converse with my husband. Breakfast was buffet style at the adjacent restaurant (on the property) and more than ample at $6 for all persons staying in the room (up to 4), and consisted of eggs, fried potatoes, ham, pancakes, toast/muffins, yogurt, cereals (3 types) and orange juice, coffee, or milk to drink. We bought steaks and bar-b-qued poolside one night at the facilities provided. The hotel is 3.9 miles to Disneyland, and we bought our park tickets through Triple A (CSAA) and got free parking at the park (saved $75) so distance was not an issue. I teach music lessons and brought back business cards and pictures for all my students who travel to Disneyland each year, I liked this little place so much. If you are looking for the Taj Mahal, then spend $200+ a night on a room. We stayed for $53/night and did way more on our vacation having saved all that money on room costs and dining out. We will go back to the Pepper Tree for sure, and I am already looking at dates to return. In all, we were there for 9 days, ample time to get the feel of a place. The only issues we had were: the maid forgot to leave coffee for the in-room coffee service one day, and, on another she accidently took our kitchen sponge. Both were quickly ammended by the front desk personel, who were also lovely. We were sorry to have to leave.
reviews.title: grate place to stay

reviews.text: This was the first time that I've disagreed with Trip Advisor ratings. Usually they are spot on and have helped me find many great hotels, such as the one we stayed at near Disney World.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.text: The Peppertree was inexpensive, especially because we had enough people for 2 rooms. The rooms were roomy and relatively clean and I suppose it was the rainstorm outside that invited all those ants to come in and visit. The place could use a little updating. The carpet in one of our rooms was patched and the color was sort of blue mud. The walls could use a coat of paint, the sofa was a little stained, and one of the sockets was not functioning. In general, for the price, it was adequate. The kitchen was very handy for one of our neighbors as the smell of curry was enjoyed by all. All this only 3 miles from Disneyland!
reviews.title: You get what you paid for

reviews.text: perfect in every way,doing the disneyland deal with little ones has in the past been a ordeal,but your staff and location was perfect, I will definatly recomend your establishment to all my friends, price,location,cleanlyness,comfort.you got it all.thank you so much,my first vacation in more than 20 years and im glad we ended up with you.Really I cant thank you enough, A special thank you to your house cleaning,the girls went beyond norms, (putting our daughters pillow pets) set up on the beds,real personall thank you, michael,vera.imogene.tyra and gracey, stewart
reviews.title: excellent!! just what we needed,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived tired from other excursions around LA, and found a beautiful room with southwest furnishings and a comfortable bed waiting for us. The service was prompt and friendly, the room was spacious with a lovely balcony, and there were amenities for just about everything we could need. Only a few minutes away from the Disney parks and great food.
reviews.title: Great place to relax between excursions and parks nearby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: affordable stay in Anaheim. a bit of a drive to Disneyland, but not too bad. the rooms are very spacious. lovely gratuities welcome you on arrival - a pack of toiletries, all sorts of freebies. nice clean towels and linens. kitchen is fully equipped. don't know if this is a normal thing in US hotels but no fresh milk in the fridge??? eat breakfast somewhere else. the buffet breakfast that they offer you at front desk when you check in is rather sad. the whole hotel could do with a renovation soon. the 'old' smell of the hotel room takes a bit of getting used to. lucky we brought room spray.
reviews.title: okay value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel before and had fallen in love with it. Despite the neighborhood and the low points the charm and service won me over. The last and most recent time will be my last. The girl at the front desk was so rude to me and my husband that i found it shocking! In taking up her rudeness with the manager the next day we got more of the same and he stood up for her. I am in real estate and have referred many people here much to my regret now. I have noticed the declined in this hotel since my first stay years ago but my last experience...... I don't really have words for it.
reviews.title: Worst Customer service EVER!!!!!

reviews.text: The girls at the front desk Gabby and Daisy brought my daughter a bouquet of pink Disney baloons for her first birthday on the first night of our stay. Every one there is extremely polite and helpful. I would most deffinetly stay there again. But for anyone looking to stay here i would recommend staying on the bottom floor because you get a private little patio with a fountain. The breakfast at the little restaurant in the front isnt that good, but thats why theres little kitchens in all the rooms :)
reviews.title: Best hotel near Disneyland for the price !!

reviews.text: I stayed here for five days while vacationing at Disneyland and visiting the beach. The place was clean, the kitchen fully stocked with everything I needed and the staff was friendly and helpful. I wouldn't bother with the restaurant Aztecas, as I had a bad time with them, but the hotel itself was incredible and awesome!
reviews.title: Really wonderful place to relax after a long day at the beach or Disneyland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Saved a lot by cooking for myself. The bed was fantastic, I loved the decor and my nonsmoking room was just that. Next time I go to anaheim, I will choose the Pepper Tree.... It is in a convenient area as well, close to all the attractions, the beach, and a decent neighborhood.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, and unique room at a nice, pet friendly hotel.

reviews.text: This hotel is perfect for the person who likes hotels that do not have that chain feel. It is staffed, by friendly, helpful people. We have stayed here twice and have had a positive experience each time. It is pretty only about a 15 minute drive to Disneyland, if that is why you are in town. There is a small kitchen with paper towels, dishes, dish soap, and other items so all you have to bring is the food. They even had ice cube trays in the freezer! On our last trip, we wanted a home base that we could poke around from, and this hotel was good for that too, it is maybe a half-hour drive from the ocean. The rooms are unique, and do not have that cookie cutter feel you can get in other hotels. The hallways are wide and well-lit. The curtins to the balcony are good at keeping out the sun when you want a little extra sleep in the morning. Most of the rooms overlook parking lots, but other than that the hotel meets all of our expectations. We found them to be pet-friendly, which on our last trip was the deal-maker...we couldn't find anyone to watch our dog at the last minute and we were pleased to find out that The Hotel Pepper Tree is pet friendly (with a very reasonable pet fee). All in all we like staying here. Oh, and they have wireless internet available (ours was 5$ for two days) which is a must.
reviews.title: A sweet little surprise in Anaheim

reviews.text: We wanted to find a nice place to stay in Anaheim where we would start our USA trip, the first stop being Disneyland. Hotel Pepper Tree provided us with a homely kitchenette suite with a sweet spanish touch that was affordable for our budget. We were pleasantly surprised and felt instantly at home there. We are from Australia, and found out the owners were 2 aussie couples so that also helped us make our decision. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the housekeeping was impeccable, as expected. We would definitely stay at this lovely little place again if we decided to visit the USA again in future.
reviews.title: Home away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I were pleased with the hotel. While there is always opportunity to criticize, this hotel was an excellent value. Spacious and furnished with some rustic wooden furniture, it has a cozier feel to it than one would expect from looking at it from the outside. The sheets were clean - which is an absolute imperative in our book. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel, as is true of most places in Anaheim has seen its share of wear and tear but the overall cleanliness of the place was above average. We were both pleased with our stay here and would recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Will stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel 3 times over the past 2 years and each time our experience was worse then the one before it. The hotel used to give you a coupon for a free glass of wine and $20 off your next stay but they no longer offer either. The free continental breakfast is now $2 a person. Also, the price of the room has gone up each time so needless to say we will not be returning. This is a brief summary of our trip;
reviews.title: Downhill

reviews.text: First night: The only problem we immediately realized was that the tub did not drain properly. We were told a maintenance man would come to fix it but he never did.
reviews.title: Decent...hoping for better

reviews.text: Second night: At around 8 pm we started to hear a lot of noise coming from the upstairs room. Because it was relatively early we did not complain. The noise stopped but then came back at around 12:30 am. We called the front desk and they told us to wait for 10 minutes to see if the noise stopped and if not they would go to the room. We waited and called back. The front desk sent someone who said the room was full of children and that they "promised to behave". The noise stopped until around 6 am, when it came back in full force. We complained again and were relocated to a different room at 6:30 am.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel If You're Going to Disneyland!

reviews.text: Third night: After I asked someone to clean our room and change our towels neither was done. Also, the HBO on our TV did not work due to parental controls that we nor the staff could turn off. Plus, we were put in a room that did not have a door on the bathroom.
reviews.title: Pepper Tree is my second home

description: Discover old fashioned hospitality at Hotel Pepper Tree, a unique extended stay hotel with kitchens in Southern California style and rustic Spanish influence. With warm earthy decor, hand–crafted wood furniture, and Hollywood memorabilia, our home–style boutique hotel is the perfect place to work or unwind in Orange County.
